title: David Masser
summary: David William Masser (born 8 November 1948) FRS is Professor Emeritus in the Department of Mathematics and Computer Science at the University of Basel.[1] He is known for his work in transcendental number theory, Diophantine approximation, and Diophantine geometry. With Joseph Oesterl√© in 1985, Masser formulated the abc conjecture, which has been called "the most important unsolved problem in Diophantine analysis".[2]
